 Your Login ID is:  188441-85978086@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17813

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fprincipal-personnel-files-pritzker-pulaski-188441%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOYGcc%3A1uUdLw%3ABsWK8Qwxri217EmPfpQcJKUnkx7nwjPW8wj27JZsfro RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, health information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. 
Certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personnel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. Redactions have been made pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City of North Richland Hills FOIA)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City of North Richland Hills FOIA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P053528-061925
communications.communication:
Dear Wendy Sawyer: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Washington Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 6/19/2025 and given the reference number P053528-061925 for tracking purposes. 
This message is an automated confirmation of your request, and does not constitute an official Department acknowledgement under RCW 42.56.520. Agency staff will provide a separate correspondence formally acknowledging this request within 5 business days. 
You can monitor the progress of your request in " My Request Center"

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P053528-061925
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Wendy Sawyer, 

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request submitted on June 19, 2025 and received in our office on June 20, 2025. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-53528. 
You requested the following records:  
  * A list of people on both the sex offender registry and probation, 
  * A list of people on both the sex offender registry and parole. To process your request, clarification is needed. The Department of Corrections doesn't maintain the sex offender registry. I believe those offenders register with their local sheriff's office, so you could request a list from those offices. You could also try websites like the Washington Sex Offender Public Registry (www.wasor.org). 
I can provide a list of sex offenders currently on DOC supervision and their current sex offender level, and whether they were overseen by the Indeterminate Sentence Review Board (ISRB). Let me know if you'd like me to proceed with this list or something else. 
If no response is received within 30 days, this request will be closed and you will have one year to seek judicial review under the PRA. 
Sincerely, 
Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist 
Department of Corrections 
Public Records Unit 
P.O. Box 41118 
Olympia, WA 98504 

CE: P-53528

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P053528-061925
communications.communication:
Hi Celeste,

Thank you so much for your willingness to provide the information that you do have. 

Yes, I would be grateful if you could provide a list of sex offenders currently on DOC supervision and their SO level, and whether they were overseen by the ISRB. 

This data will still be helpful as I am trying to understand the number of SO that are on registries and on any further form of community supervision.

Thank you so much.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Wendy Sawyer, 
Thank you for the clarification provided on July 6, 2025. Department staff have begun processing your request. I anticipate releasing records to you within 18 business days, on or before August 8, 2025. 
Sincerely, 
Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P053528-061925
communications.communication:

Wendy Sawyer, 

This letter is regarding your public records request, tracking # P-53528. There are 83 pages responsive to your request. Please log in to the GovQA portal to retrieve the records. 
These records are provided to you in accordance with the Public Records Act. By making agency documents available to you, the Department is not responsible for your use of the information or for any claims or liabilities that may result from your use or further dissemination. 

Your request is now closed. The Department does not intend to further address this request, and the PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter. Please contact me within 30 days via GovQA or at the address below if you have any questions. 

Sincerely, 
Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist

Washington State Department of Corrections

communications.subject: **FOAA Request** 202572 Wendy Sawyer 21 Jul 25
communications.communication:
The Maine Department of Corrections has received your request for information under the Maine Freedom of Access Act (FOAA).  Your request will be evaluated to determine if it comes within the FOAA, if it is clear as to what information you are requesting, and if nonconfidential records already exist that would fulfill all or part of your request.  If your request does not come within the FOAA, is not clear, or no records exist, you will be so notified.  If records exist, but they are confidential, you will be notified of the basis for that determination.  If nonconfidential records exist, you will be provided a good faith, nonbinding estimate of the time within which you will be provided the records, as well as an estimate of the costs that are allowed by the FOAA, if applicable.

V/r

Jenna Heald
Maine Department of Corrections
Policy & PowerDMS Assistant
FOAA Coordinator

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Ben HeckscherUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Famtrak-479%252Famtrak-board-of-directors-meeting-minutes-jan-2025-3rd-request-190635%252F%253Femail%253DFOIAPublicLiaison%252540amtrak.com&url_auth_token=AAATVczgYa5hDtGppW4msQn1q3M%3A1ujUI2%3AGVSA1QZmV22z04UGbsgVs1uzjyZAbcHp_iLS7NF7-LQ. Portions were redacted under FOIA Exemption 5.  FOIA Exemption 5 (deliberative process privilege) applies to inter-agency or intra-agency records where, for instance, there is a work product that is in draft format or documents that contain deliberations between parties leading up to a decision. 

Pursuant to Amtrak’s FOIA regulations (49 CFR 701.10), if you do not agree with Amtrak’s decision, you may file an appeal with William Herrmann, Executive Vice President, Chief Legal and Human Resources Officer, within ninety days (90) of the date of this letter, specifying the relevant facts and the basis for your appeal.  Your appeal may be mailed to Mr. Herrmann’s attention:  National Railroad Passenger Corporation, Law Department, One Massachusetts Avenue, NW, Washington, DC  20001.  The President and CEO of Amtrak has delegated authority to the General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for the rules and compliance to the FOIA.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Amtrak Board of Directors - Meeting  Minutes | Mar 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The minutes for any meeting of the Amtrak Board of Directors that occurred in the month of March 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Heckscher

title: Records Request - 250 Colonnade Drive

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Request - 250 Colonnade Drive
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the multifamily property known as University Heights located at 221-276 Colonnade Drive Charlottesville VA 22903 with Parcel IDs 06000-00-00-040C6, 06000-00-00-040C7, 06000-00-00-040C4, 06000-00-00-040C5, please provide the following information:

Notice and summary of any open/outstanding zoning, building, and/or fire code violations, or written confirmation that none currently exist.
Copies of Certficates of Occupancy, or if none are available, please state the reason for their absence and whether the lack of Certificates of Occupancy will result in any enforcement action; and
Copies of any zoning approval documents, such as approved site plans, conditions of approval, variances, special/conditional use permits, etc. if applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Olivia James.

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Schertz)

communications.subject: City of Schertz - Open Records Request / ORR-400-2025
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Mr. Cavise. 
  
 Please note additional responsive records to your request, Request Number: ORR-400-2025, have been provided. Please click on the request link to download the response documentation. The City of Schertz Fire Department has a copious amount of records stored in both paper and digital copy. They are actively and diligently seeking records responsive to your request. I anticipate a response from them within the next 5-10 business days. I will convey their findings to you immediately upon receipt. Our apologies for providing the responsive records to you piecemeal. 
  
 Respectfully, 
  
 Sheree Courney, Deputy City Secretary 
  
 City of Schertz
1400 Schertz Parkway, Bldg 2
Schertz, TX 78154

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Anne-Marie Woznicki Malkovich Personnel File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dr. DiStefano,

I am requesting a copy of the entire personnel file of Anne-Marie Woznicki, also known as Anne-Marie Malkovich, an employee of the Beaver Dam Unified School District. I believe she may be related to Thomas Woznicki, a Teacher at the School District of New Richmond.

Sincerely,

Paul Peterson

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Peterson

title: Request on Political Appointees (Environmental Protection Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request on Political Appointees (Environmental Protection Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of any and all political appointments at the agency appointed from January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request.

2. Copies of resumes for any and all political appointees hired since January 20, 2025 until the date of your final response to this request. These records are likely in the possession of the Designated Agency Ethics Official (DAEO).

Please provide these records as available on a rolling basis.

Documented is an investigative watchdog and reporting group that explores the relationship between special interests and government. This request is likely to contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations of the government. Disclosure of the requested records serves the public interest, and this request is not being made for any commercial purposes. Therefore, I am requesting a waiver of any fees. If you do not grant my fee waiver request, please notify me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by email attachment or other electronic file transfer if available, or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.  I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Nina

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City of Midlothian)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City of Midlothian)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

title: Keystone Pipeline Permit Decisions, Environmental Assessments, and Internal Communications (2017-2021)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Keystone Pipeline Permit Decisions, Environmental Assessments, and Internal Communications (2017-2021)
communications.communication:
Date:  January 12th ,2024
Via Email and Certified Mail:

Headquarters, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
441 G Street NW
Washington, DC 20314-1000


Subject: FOIA Request - Keystone Pipeline Permit Decisions, Environmental Assessments, and Internal Communications (2017-2021)

Dear U.S. Army Corps of Engineers,

I am submitting this request under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S. Code § 552) for access to and copies of records from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers pertaining to the Keystone Pipeline permit. This request specifically targets decision-making processes, environmental assessments, policy implications, internal communications, and interactions with TC Energy or its affiliates during President Donald Trump's administration (January 20, 2017, to January 20, 2021).

Specific Areas of Inquiry:

Permit Processing and Decision Making (2017-2021):

Documentation detailing the processing, review, and decisions regarding the Keystone Pipeline permit.
Communications involving Corps officials and senior administration figures, particularly focusing on the involvement of Secretary of Energy Dan Brouillette.
Environmental Assessments and Impact Reports (2017-2021):

Environmental impact studies and assessments conducted or reviewed by the Corps regarding the Keystone Pipeline.
Internal discussions, memos, or reports addressing environmental concerns or risks.
Internal Communications (2017-2021):

Internal emails, memos, and communications within the Corps regarding the Keystone Pipeline project.
Discussions and correspondence that provide insight into the internal perspectives and debates about the project.
Communications with TC Energy and Affiliates (2017-2021):

Records of communications between the Corps and TC Energy or its affiliates.
Documentation of any meetings or negotiations involving TC Energy representatives.
External Influence and Lobbying (2017-2021):

Records detailing lobbying efforts or attempts to influence the Corps regarding the Keystone Pipeline permit.
Evidence of external entities' influence on the Corps' decision-making processes.
Legal Citations and Compliance:

Department of Justice v. Tax Analysts, 492 U.S. 136, 142 (1989)
Environmental Protection Agency v. Mink, 410 U.S. 73 (1973)
Favish v. National Archives and Records Administration, 541 U.S. 157 (2004)
American Civil Liberties Union v. Department of Justice, 655 F.3d 1 (D.C. Cir. 2011)
Fees and Waiver Request:
Enclosed is a Fee Waiver Request Form, requesting a waiver of all fees as this information is intended for public dissemination, per 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

Response Timeframe and Legal Implications:
A response is expected within the statutory 20-day period as mandated by FOIA. Non-compliance or undue delay may result in legal action to enforce FOIA compliance.

Record Keeping for Legal Purposes:
Please assign a unique identifier to this FOIA request and reference it in all related correspondence.

Your prompt and thorough attention to this request is greatly appreciated. I look forward to your comprehensive response.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Form

communications.subject: RE: Jordan Lassiter FOIA Request - FP-24-008302 - Acknowledgement Regarding Referral to Omaha District
communications.communication:
Mr. Lassiter,


  This will acknowledge receipt of your FOIA request dated January 16, 2024 by the US Army Corps of Engineers, Omaha District (Agency).  The agency tracking number is FA-24-0037.  Under the FOIA, your request is in the “educational/news media” fee category. This category grants the requester the first 100 duplicated pages, along with search and review time, free of charge. Thereafter you would be responsible for duplication costs associated with the processing of your request (duplication costs include time spent converting electronic files to non-editable format). However, the fee waiver that you filed has been accepted and as such you will not be charged any fees for the processing of your request.



  Due to the current coronavirus pandemic, the Omaha District is experiencing delays in our ability to process FOIA requests. Because our office currently has a backlog of requests, your request will be placed on a calendar/tracking system behind others received before it, and each is processed in the order it was received. Should you have any questions please feel free to contact me.



Thank you,
Nicole Day

Nicole M. Day
Paralegal Specialist
U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Omaha District
(402) 995-2603
nicole.m.day@usace.army.mil<mailto:nicole.m.day@usace.army.mil>

communications.communication:
To Whom it May Concern:

I believe Mr. Lassiter filed FOIA request FA-24-0037.

Due to the volume of information that was requested regarding the Keystone Pipeline project and the timeline of the project (2017-2021) there are some additional complications above the Omaha District’s current backlog of FOIA requests. Some of the responsive information is from retired employees and has been archived. In order to provide that information in a format that you will be able to open, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Cyber Forensics unit will need to convert the files. The ticket has been filed, but it is awaiting an Action Officer who can discuss the timeframe for their response with me.

The remaining responsive files have been searched for and the legal review process is commencing.

Thank you,
Nicole Day

For future status updates please refer to request Lassiter FP-24-008332/FA-24-0037. Failure to do so will result in a non-response.

I am unable to provide an estimated completion date at this time for the following reasons:

1. The volume of the records requested; and

2. The need to consult with another Office to determine the ability to release or withhold sensitive records included within the responsive materials.

If you wish to encourage the process, you may consider narrowing the request or providing clarification on what information within the large volume of records requested that are of the most importance to you. In order to assist you in doing so, a copy of the original request, filed by Jordan Lassiter is attached.

Please note that the request for a fee waiver is considered null as the request falls under the “educational/news media” fee category which provides search and review time free of charge.

Nicole Day

title: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Access Public Records Request :: R020623-061925
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

   
  
    
  
  
  Public Records Request - R020623-061925 Good afternoon, 
We are writing to advise you that your request has been received and is in our queue. Please note there are procedures and statutes we must follow in order to gather and redact responsive records if any are located. In addition, we receive a large volume of requests of varying sizes and complexity, we ordinarily operate on a first-in, first-out basis, to ensure all requesters are treated fairly, and we are diligently working on all requests to ensure they are responded to as quickly as possible. We will keep you updated on the status of your request through the public records request portal. Sincerely, Public Records

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Access Public Records Request :: R020623-061925
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

   
  
    
  
  
  Public Access Public Records Request - R020623-061925 Good morning, We do not provide individual-level data in response to public records requests due to operational, safety, and security concerns. Publicly available data a nd reports on our inmate population are available here: https://  corrections.az.gov/data- reports . Specific to your request: 1. Probation is handled by each individual county in Arizona and the information would need to be requested through the adult probation department from each of the counties. 2. We currently have 314 registerable/notifiable sex offenders on supervision. This request is now complete. Sincerely, 

Public Records

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2025, to June 30, 2025. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2025, to June 30, 2025. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.communication:
City of Prosser, WA ************************************************************************ Record request #25-206 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, the City of Prosser has received your request. The documents the City believes are responsive to your request are attached. Please be aware that the City searched its records only. The databank we searched does not account for any other agency, community, or police department. This response completes your request. If our interpretation of your request is incorrect, please notify me in writing by clarifying the intent of your request.  After review, it was determined that the request for Flock’s Network Audit records does not meet the definition of a “public record” under the Washington Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.010(3). A public record includes any writing prepared, owned, used, or retained by a state or local government agency that contains information relating to the conduct of government or the performance of any governmental or proprietary function. Specifically, the records requested are not prepared, owned, used, or retained by the City in a manner that constitutes a public record under the PRA. The requested documents consist of Flock’s reporting of which other agencies accessed data; the City does not prepare, own, use, or retain this audit report. Therefore, the portion of the request for Flock’s network audits is denied because the document does not meet the definition of a public record under RCW 42.56.010(3). Thank you, City of Prosser Staff www.cityofprosser.com City Hall (509) 786-2332 Police Business Office (509)786-1500 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Prosser, WA.

Technical support: See our help page

title: Evergreen Solutions (Prince George's Community College)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (Prince George's Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: For Alisia Rios at Evergreen Solutions Regarding MPIA Request to Prince George's Community College
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

This email is intended to go to Alisia Rios, Data Analyst at Evergreen Solutions, LLC.

Ms. Rios, Prince George's Community College has received your letter, dated March 6, 2025, requesting the inspection of public records pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act. The College received your letter on Monday, March 17, 2025, after returning from spring break closure. Your request has been forwarded to College departments that may have existing records that are responsive to your request. Please be advised that the Maryland Public Information Act does not require the College to answer informational questions or create new records to satisfy your request. Please be further advised that the College charges fees for the completion of such requests if it takes more than two hours of staff time to fulfill. At this moment, I have asked for an estimated time amount from the departments who may have access to responsive documents, as your request is extensive and I believe it will take more than two hours to fulfill. Once I have their responses, I will provide you with an estimated fee, at which point you may let me know if you wish the College to proceed with gathering the documents.

Regards,

Justin Douds, J.D.
He/Him/His

Vice President, Policy and General Counsel
301-546-PGCC (7422) - ext. 60590
Prince George's Community College - 301 Largo Road, Largo, MD 20774

communications.subject: RE: For Alisia Rios at Evergreen Solutions Regarding MPIA Request to Prince George's Community College
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

This email is once again intended for Alisia Rios, Data Analyst at Evergreen Solutions, LLC.

Ms. Rios, on March 19, 2025, I notified you that Prince George's Community College (the College) had received your extensive MPIA request upon return from its spring break on March 17, 2025. I advised that I had asked the departments who may have access to responsive documents for an estimated time for their efforts, and noted that the College charges fees for all time expended beyond the first two hours.  PGCC's MPIA fee schedule (and other FAQs about PGCC's MPIA processing) can be found at this link: https://www.pgcc.edu/about-pgcc/institutional-information--policies/maryland-public-information-act-mpia-requests/.

In this case, the College estimates that it will take 2 employees 8 hours each to fulfill the request, with one employee researching the faculty and staff census information, and the other gathering documents listed at the bottom of the request. Based on salary, one employee's hourly compensation is $57.27, and the other's hourly compensation is $61.25. Thus, PGCC estimates that you would be charged $711.12 for the production of records to fulfill your request ($57.27 x 6 additional hours PLUS $61.25 x 6 additional hours). Because the information would be provided electronically, you would not be charged any additional fees for the production of records in a type of medium (CD, photographs, etc.). Please note that this is an estimate, and the actual fee for the collection of records pursuant to this request may be fewer or greater than $711.12

Under the MPIA, you may seek a fee waiver if 1) you are indigent or 2) you believe a waiver would be in the public interest.

Please confirm whether you still wish to receive the information. If so, we will gather the information and provide you with the actual fee amount, and connect you with the Bursar's office for collection of payment prior to releasing the information.

Regards,


Justin Douds, J.D.
He/Him/His

Vice President, Policy and General Counsel

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (Prince George's Community College)
communications.communication:
Greetings,
I hope this message finds you well.

We are currently in the process of submitting the document as discussed. Before proceeding with payment, my project manager has asked that we confirm the contents of the information we will be receiving. In the past, we've had experiences with other organizations where, unfortunately, we completed payment but did not receive all of the requested data.

To avoid any confusion or delays, would it be possible for you to provide a brief summary of the materials being sent? This will help us ensure everything is accounted for prior to payment.

For reference, here is an example of the type of summary we’re looking for:

1. Staff Census
(Includes job classification, FTE status, pay ranges, and salary grades)

2. Staff Handbook
(Employee policies, code of conduct, benefits, and general procedures)

3. Staff Policies
(Attendance, leave, performance evaluations, remote work, etc.)

4. Job Descriptions
(For all staff-classified employees, including roles, responsibilities, and qualifications)

Thank you in advance for your understanding and assistance. We look forward to receiving the summary so we can move forward accordingly.

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (Public Works Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (Public Works Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

title: Expedited FOIA requests (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Expedited FOIA requests (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
